PUT data to Trello API

Source: R/put_model.R
put_model.Rd

Issues PUT requests for Trello API endpoints.

put_model(model, id = NULL, path = NULL, body = NULL, token = NULL,
  response = "content", on.error = "warning", encode = "json",
  handle = NULL, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

model

Model
id

Model id
path

Path
body

A named list of query paramters (will be passed as body)
token

Secure token, see get_token (scope must include write permissions)
response

Can return "content" (default), "headers", "status" code or the complete "response"
on.error

Issues either warning (default), message or error (and stops)
encode

Passed to PUT
handle

Passed to PUT
verbose

Whether to pass verbose() to PUT

Details

See Trello API reference for more info about what arguments can be passed to PUT requests.

Examples


if (FALSE) {

# Get token with write access
token = get_token(yourkey, yoursecret, scope = c("read", "write"))

# Get board ID
url = "Your board URL"
bid = get_id_board(url, token)

# Get cards and extract ID of the first one
cid = get_board_cards(bid, token)$id[1]

# Content for the new card
payload = list(
  id = cid,
  name = "A new card name",
  desc = "Description - updated by trelloR",
  pos = "top" #put card on the top of a list
)

# Update card's name, descriptionand position
put_model(model = "card", id = cid, body = payload, token = token)
}
